metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4560 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in lighttpd before 1.4.33 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault and crash) via unspecified vectors that trigger FAMMonitorDirectory failures.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4560` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lighttpd - 1.4.33-1+nmu2ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-cml - 1.4.33-1+nmu2ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-magnet - 1.4.33-1+nmu2ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-mysql-vhost - 1.4.33-1+nmu2ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-trigger-b4-dl - 1.4.33-1+nmu2ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-webdav - 1.4.33-1+nmu2ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lighttpd package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.33-1+nmu2ubuntu2').
